Yes, here are a few recommended resources to learn more about Ramakrishna and his teachings:

1. "The Gospel of Sri Ramakrishna" by Swami Nikhilananda - This is a comprehensive account of Ramakrishna's life and teachings, as recorded by his disciple, Mahendranath Gupta. This book provides insights into Ramakrishna's states of ecstasy and his teachings on spirituality. 2. "Ramakrishna and His Disciples" by Christopher Isherwood - This book is a personal account of the author's experiences with the Ramakrishna Order and his interactions with Ramakrishna's disciples. It provides a glimpse into the daily life and teachings of the Ramakrishna Order. 3. "Ramakrishna and Vivekananda: New Perspectives" edited by Shalini Advani - This book is a collection of essays that examine the life and teachings of Ramakrishna and his disciple, Swami Vivekananda. It offers a modern perspective on Ramakrishna's teachings and their relevance today. 4. "Introduction to Vedanta" by Swami Dayananda - This book provides an introduction to the philosophical system of Vedanta, which underlies many of Ramakrishna's teachings. It provides an overview of the Vedantic concepts and principles that are essential for understanding Ramakrishna's teachings. I hope these resources are helpful in your quest to learn more about Ramakrishna and his teachings!
